title: Test setup requires short base path on Windows
body:
Demo test:

```
@with_tempfile
@with_tempfile
def test_annex_drop(src, dst):
    s = AnnexRepo(src)
    (s.pathobj / 'test-annex.dat').write_text("content")
    s.save('some')

    ar = AnnexRepo.clone(src, dst)
    testfile = 'test-annex.dat'
    assert_false(ar.file_has_content(testfile))
    ar.get(testfile)
 ```

It passes on linux, it works on windows if the principle equivalent command order (just plain git and git-annex) is typed into a `cmd.exe`, it works when using the high-level datalad commands on windows, it works when this code is executed in a standalone python session on windows.

It does not work when executed as part of the datalad test suite.

In this last case it throws:

```
datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError: '"git" "annex" "get" "--json" "--json-error-messages" "--json-progress" "-c" "annex.dotfiles=true" "-c" "annex.retry=3" "--" "test-annex.dat"' failed with exitcode 1 under C:\Users\datalad\AppData\Local\Temp\datalad_temp_8oyv2y7c [err: 'git-annex: get: 1 failed'] [errors from JSON records: [[]]] [info keys: stdout_json]
```

That does say much, but going into that repo and running the `get` again reveals

```
C:\Users\datalad\AppData\Local\Temp\datalad_temp_6mdgp88e>git annex get test-annex.dat
get test-annex.dat
  Unable to access these remotes: origin

  Try making some of these remotes available:
        8c5fdf62-ddc8-47ae-ae7a-8d2295821901 -- datalad@latitude-e7440:~/AppData\Local\Temp\datalad_temp__u8s9_s6 [origin]
failed
git-annex: get: 1 failed
```

But origin exists, has the key, and `git-annex sync` interacts with it just fine. And, again, the analog `get` in a repo that was not prepared as part of a test run, but with identical code, works just fine.
